newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turk shares ease in thin pre-holiday trade.
newsitem.headline: Turk shares ease in thin pre-holiday trade.

text.p: Istanbul shares dropped in subdued trade on Wednesday ahead of a 6-1/2-day holiday beginning from mid-Thurday, brokers said.
The IMKB National-100 closed down 12 points, or 0.78 percent at 1,523. Trade volume retreated to 14.07 trillion lira ($106.2 million) from Tuesday's 17.52 trillion ($132.2 million).
"Volume was very low and trade margins were narrow due to approaching holiday. Only a few stocks were active. I expect this trend to continue tomorrow," said Fatih Aslanoba from Alfa securities.
The market will close after the first session on Thursday and reopen on April 24, Thursday due to a 4-1/2-day religious holiday to be followed by a national holiday on April 23.
"I expect some selling next Thursday and Friday ahead of the National Security Council (MGK) meeting," Aslanoba said.

The market is unnerved by the MGK meeting scheduled for April 26 following a rift which emerged between the coalition's Islamist and conservative wings after the secularist military demanded measures against rising Islamist zeal in the February 28 MGK meeting.
